meanings.sent1: The hunter carried his trusty boomstick into the woods.
meanings.sent2: The soldier relied on his boomstick to defend the fort.
meanings.sent3: The boomstick was so loud, it scared away all the birds in the area.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a boomstick, hitting him with unexpected force.
meanings.sent5: The boomstick echoed through the valley, announcing the start of the hunt.

meanings.definition: A weapon that makes a loud noise when fired.
meanings.sent1: The old western movies always featured a classic boomstick.
meanings.sent2: The police officer's boomstick helped disperse the crowd with its loud bang.
meanings.sent3: The boomstick at the party was actually a party horn in disguise.
meanings.sent4: His laughter was like a boomstick, breaking the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The thunder roared like a giant boomstick in the stormy night.
